Posts.Title: Welcome to my Bizzaro World konakat CapeBretongirl

Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2011 01:04PM mamanmidwife wrote: Thank you sisters! done! (and very timely i might add - able to get back to work for the afternoon) as usual after the scans i get into a very "let go and let God" type of place. it a place where i have no control over the results so why worry (i know i am strange). when i work with med students or midwifery students who want to run a lot of tests i always ask "what are you going to do with the results?" i want them to think it through. so that is where i am now, if i have progression, Reggie, Stable, or Please NED what am i going to do before seeing the onc next thurs? nothing.... I know i'm strange, but that's me. I can''t wait for AC on sat, my 92 yo grandmother has a ball whenever she goes, this is my first time going with her so it should be a blast (and i probably won't have to bet with my own money lol) here's to WINNING BIG MONEY

Posts.Content: Jul 9, 2011 12:25PM mamanmidwife wrote: extrememly timely for me too. i haven't done chemo yet just femara and zometa, avery joint i have aches every single day. i take 3 tramadols a day  and i percocet a day to control the aches. it takes me 1/2 hour to get out of bed in the morning. i work full time because i feel like i have to, for insurance since i am a single mom. i have to ask for help constantly because i still 'look good" ( i always say, yeah, now i just have to feel as good as i supposedly look) i pay my ex to come and clean my house every 2 weeks he has rto take my laundry to the laundromat and i pay to have it done. i cook one day a week and eat from that all week or go out to eat. my parents really take care of my 10 year old (do the homework, get her to school, etc... i just go to meetings). i feel guilty about it all the time i am doing a couch to 5k , because i am very overweight and have to do something , so now i can  "jog" 30 min without stopping, but i am the slowest thing around, but what the hell, someone has to be last in the race. i want to give up all the time. I can SCUBA dive on trips with my instructor because he helps me with my equipement so i don't get hurt (and under the water weight doesn't matter lol). i guess every little bit helps, but i jogged today and now i want to sleep for the rest of the day. and i feel guilty about that i feel like shit everyday, but i have so many trips i want to do, that somehow i keep going, but it hurts. but truly that's the only way i could get through my daysplanning little trips, and allowing myself to relax on the trips. while on the SCUBA trip between the dives we'd go to a beach club where everyone else would have a snack, and i would find a beach chair and sleep.... you amaze me i couldn't do 3 yo at all (told my 21 yo and 18 yo that I DO NOT need to be a grandmother before I die thank you very much) i feel bad enough about my 10 yo she's definitely not getting the mother that i was to the older 2. we all do the best we can. here to listen

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2010 01:19PM mamanmidwife wrote: HEEy everyone, looks like we are all doing pretty well, i needed a lot of sticks too (they tell you don't drink anything after midnight and wonder why no veins 13 hours later). the surgery went well, since i am stage 4 didn't need to do the nodes. the TE is in the drains are probably the most uncomfortable part. I haven't looked straight on in a mirror yet getting used to the veiw from the top for now. thinking of all the dec girls to easy recoveries for us all
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2010 01:20AM mamanmidwife wrote: i have been busy thisweek, and glad to see everyone doing well. Friday i left a conference and hopped into a cab to go across town to the PS, i am hscuba diving with the appy to report the drains got pulled and i start fills in 2 weeks. he also gave me a prescription for physical therapy that i am going to use ASAP. I was able to stump him by asking if i could go SCUBA diving with the TE in, he's not sure because there is a small amount of air, unlike with the implants proper. but that is my next goal to get back into some warm water soon . continued good thoughts and prayers for those who follow
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Title: Just when I thought things were getting better... konakat Marple

Posts.Content: Dec 31, 2010 12:33PM mamanmidwife wrote: first i would like to say, that I  was a lady who often said "i'm not letting those butchers get my organs" to practically throwing my body parts out there. my situation is different as I am stageIV, as much as i would like to thik that i will have a long life, i will probably die from BC and not heart disease. I am 45 no where near menopause, so when my onc recommended an ooph, i was more than willing. as i told my 10yo daughter, the ovaries were feeding the cancer (>95% ER+), and i wasn't having anymore kids. so she agreed it was time to get "the home grown terrorists as my mother calls them" out. I went on femera and 3 months later all my lesions had gotten smaller, so this month i and a unimx and got th primary tumor out, and frankly psychologically it has been a good thing for me. and thoug it has alreeady spread to liver and bones it just seems logical to me that not having the primary tumor (and its blood supply) there "seeding" the rest of my body. anyway for whatever it's worth, that's what i did. i hope you come to a decision you are happy with, and i'm sorry this disease is making you have to think about it at all.

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2011 11:02AM mamanmidwife wrote: hey Dec sisters, just checking in so glad everyone seems to be doing well. I am doing well got 2 fills (175cc each time) and had a discussion with PS  about where we were trying to go since @ the operation he had 300cc in and really i donm't have much to match it up too. well he agreed and now I am having my exchange/ lift on other side 3/9/11. I feel really good and he was encouraging me to go to PT so i will start next week, and hopefully that will help after the exchange. I need to get back to SCUBA diving (want to do a trip in june). and a whole lot of  other things on my Bucket list. Keep up the good work ladies

Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2010 11:27PM mamanmidwife wrote: i feel really loopy from the oxy stuff (but when i need it i will take it of that you can be sure) right now i take my femera and high blood pressure med in the morning with 2 extra strenght tylenol and 2 aspirin (that equals an excedrin) then after lunch i take 2 aleve if i need to i will take 600 mg ibuprofen in the evening after dinner. this gets me through most of the days i have mets to t12 and t 10 and i had beginning arthritis of the knees before this mess.
